Data object with no data

Data object with non-mutable data (not memory managed)

Data oject with dynamically allocated memory with s bytes (resizeable)

Member Function Documentation

int var::Data::alloc ( size_t  s,
bool  resize = false 
)

Reallocate the data storage

Parameters
sThe number of bytes to allocate
resizeif true, the old data is copied to the new data location
Returns
virtual size_t var::Data::calc_size ( ) const
inlinevirtual

For top level data objects this is the same as capacity(). Other objects may re-implement to change how much user data is available. For example, Var::String will return the size of the string rather than the capacity of the data object

Returns
The number of bytes availabe in a data object

Reimplemented in sgfx::Bitmap.

size_t var::Data::capacity ( ) const
inline

This method will return the current capcity of the data storage object.

Returns
Number of bytes in the data object
char* var::Data::cdata ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a char pointer to the data. This will return zero if the data is readonly.

const char* var::Data::cdata_const ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a pointer to const char data.

void var::Data::clear ( )

Write all zeros to the data. This will not attempt to write read-only data.

void* var::Data::data ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a pointer to the data. This will return zero if the data is readonly.

const void* var::Data::data_const ( ) const
inline

Retrieve a pointer to const data.

void var::Data::fill ( unsigned char  d)

Fill the data with the specified value. This will not attempt to write read-only data.

Parameters
Thevalue to write to the data
static size_t var::Data::min_size ( )
static

The minimum data storage size of any data object

int var::Data::resize ( size_t  s)
inline

Resize the data

This is the same as alloc() with resize set to true

Parameters
sThe number of new bytes
Returns
Zero on success or -1 with errno set
void var::Data::set ( void *  mem,
size_t  s,
bool  readonly = false 
)

Set the storage object of the data

Parameters
memA pointer to a fixed place in memory to use as storage
sThe number of bytes allocated
readonlytrue if readonly (used for data stored in flash)
int var::Data::set_min_capacity ( size_t  s)

Set the minimum capacity of the data storage area

If the current capacity is less than s, the object will be resized.

Parameters
sThe number of minimum bytes needed
Returns
Zero on success
